p: ZME showed potential antiarthritis effects in membrane stabilization assay, proteinase inhibitory assay, and protein denaturation inhibition assays. The inhibition rates in the above three experiments were 84.72 ± 1.38%, 82.72 ± 1.48%, and 81.68 ± 1.66%, respectively [ 81]. When Ezzat et al. investigated the anti-inflammatory effect of ZAE on carrageenan-induced rat paw oedema in rats, they found that ZAE exerted an anti-inflammatory property by reducing PGE2 level and improving inflammatory markers [ 82].
